title: Brazilian football fan slammed for swinging his tiny son around by the leg as he celebrates goal
text:
A football supporter has been blasted for celebrating his team's goal by grabbing his young son by the leg and flinging him around in the air.

The man, who has not been named, was celebrating the third goal in Brazilian side Flamengo's 5-0 victory over Gremio at the Maracana in Rio de Janeiro yesterday.

The footage, which has been viewed over 1.1million times, shows the moment after a player scores a penalty.

It led to the fan standing in front of the television holding the young boy by his ankle.

The man (left and right with his son), who has not been named, was celebrating the third goal in Brazilian side Flamengo's 5-0 victory against Gremio at Rio de Janeiro's Maracana stadium

Local media reported the child is his son, although it is unclear how old the boy is.

In the background, people can be heard laughing as he yells at the top of his lungs in celebration.

Despite a woman taking the child away from the man, he continues to celebrate and cheers in front of the television.

The footage, which has been viewed over 1.1million times, shows the moment after a player scores a penalty. It led to the fan standing in front of the television holding the young boy by his ankle

He grabs hold of his crotch as the person filming him is heard laughing at his reaction.

But social media users slammed the fan's behaviour, with one branding him a 'piece of s**t'.

Another wrote: 'I do not know what bothers me more, that this guy shakes the boy like that, or that the girl, who I am assuming is the kid's mother, is laughing.'

In the background, people can be heard laughing as he yells at the top of his lungs in celebration. Despite a woman taking the child away from the man, he continues to celebrate and yells in front of the television

Gabriel of Brazil's Flamengo celebrates at the end of a Copa Libertadores semifinal second leg against Gremio at the Maracana stadium in Rio de Janeiro

One man commented: 'This is serious, he could have caused the child a serious injury!'

While a woman claimed: wrote: 'He almost killed him.'

The victory gave Flamengo a spot in the Copa Libertadores final to be played on November 23 against Argentine side River Plate.

It is scheduled to be played in the Chilean capital city Santiago, however, there have been reports of potentially changing the venue due to civil unrest in the city.
